snippet.textDisplay: Did not have the opportunity to play Xenosaga when I had my ps2 but after playing Xenoblade Chronicles (could not finish it!, I will soon don't worry, I got to an area before going to Mechonis) I fell in love with the series. Project X looks like Xenoblade Chronicles (of course) mixed with Gundam! can't wait for it! as always great track Supra.

snippet.textDisplay: My least favorite game in the trilogy has my favorite soundtrack, which isn't too surprising since I usually like anything Shinji Hosoe composes. I can hear a lot of similarities between this soundtrack and Opoona's, actually. I still want a new Xeno game, but Monolith Soft is already busy with Project X on Wii U and that looks downright amazing. Can't wait to see more from it during E3.
snippet.textOriginal: My least favorite game in the trilogy has my favorite soundtrack, which isn't too surprising since I usually like anything Shinji Hosoe composes. I can hear a lot of similarities between this soundtrack and Opoona's, actually. I still want a new Xeno game, but Monolith Soft is already busy with Project X on Wii U and that looks downright amazing. Can't wait to see more from it during E3.

snippet.textDisplay: @Evilriku13 Next week, so just a couple of days away at this point. :D

snippet.textDisplay:
@Aristotle47 I'm not Supra but I would recommend them. Xenogears is a game that everyone should play if they love good story in a game, no questions.

As for Xenosaga, I still recommend them heavily. I is a great game all its own, and while I found it kind of disorganized, it did an awesome job setting up the characters and plot.

II, as everybody will tell you (myself included), has pretty awful gameplay, but it's definitely better once you learn to manipulate it and breeze through the game. The story is still really good, and gives quite a bit more depth to some characters. Also, as you can tell so far, the soundtrack is phenomenal.

III is my favorite in the series, as it has a great soundtrack, ties a LOT of the story elements together, and massively improves (and simplifies) gameplay. The cutscenes are great, and the story finishes off strongly, and the mech battles are f*cking awesome.

TLDR: GET XENOSAGA
snippet.textOriginal:
@Aristotle47 I'm not Supra but I would recommend them. Xenogears is a game that everyone should play if they love good story in a game, no questions.

As for Xenosaga, I still recommend them heavily. I is a great game all its own, and while I found it kind of disorganized, it did an awesome job setting up the characters and plot.

II, as everybody will tell you (myself included), has pretty awful gameplay, but it's definitely better once you learn to manipulate it and breeze through the game. The story is still really good, and gives quite a bit more depth to some characters. Also, as you can tell so far, the soundtrack is phenomenal.

III is my favorite in the series, as it has a great soundtrack, ties a LOT of the story elements together, and massively improves (and simplifies) gameplay. The cutscenes are great, and the story finishes off strongly, and the mech battles are f*cking awesome.

TLDR: GET XENOSAGA

snippet.textDisplay: @ZachTheZip By name, yes. I meant the Xeno saga, which consists of 6 episodes including Xenogears and the Xenosaga trilogy. Project X will probably be related to Xenoblade storywise, it's a completely different series. Quite confusing, I'll admit!
snippet.textOriginal: @ZachTheZip By name, yes. I meant the Xeno saga, which consists of 6 episodes including Xenogears and the Xenosaga trilogy. Project X will probably be related to Xenoblade storywise, it's a completely different series. Quite confusing, I'll admit!
